document.topic_text: Government - Federal Job Description BAE Systems is looking for a Foreign Disclosure Representative with a minimum of 3 years of Foreign Disclosure experience, or equivalent amount of experience as a Special Security Officer. The Foreign Disclosure Representative works with the National Ground Intelligence Center (NGIC) Foreign Disclosure Office and Theater-based Foreign Disclosure Officers (FDO) to process CITP products for foreign release. The FDR works closely with the CITP branch analysts that author individual reports. Minimum Education and Experience Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience Required to be knowledgeable of security classification and information security procedures. Working knowledge of Microsoft® Office® tools, including SharePoint®. A high school diploma or GED is required. Preferred Skills and Education Previous background in Military Intelligence and formal training as a Foreign Disclosure Officer are desired.Bachelor's Degree preferred About BAE Systems Intelligence & Security BAE Systems Intelligence & Security, based in McLean, Virginia, designs and delivers advanced defense, intelligence, and security solutions that support the important missions of our customers. Our pride and dedication shows in everything we do-from intelligence analysis, cyber operations and IT expertise to systems development, systems integration, and operations and maintenance services. Knowing that our work enables the U.S. military and government to recognize, manage and defeat threats inspires us to push ourselves and our technologies to new levels. That's BAE Systems. That's Inspired Work. Equal Opportunity Employer/Females/Minorities/Veterans/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Gender Expression. To see Inspired Work in action, visit www.baesystems.com and follow us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/baesystemsintel. EEO Career Site Equal Opportunity Employer.
